title: Mary Bono
deleted: In 1998, before she was elected to Congress, Bono strongly supported the [[Copyright Term Extension Act]].{{citation needed|date=March 2020}}

title: Mary Bono
added: In August 2013, Bono was a panelist at the ''National Journal'''s Women 2020 event. At that event, she discussed gender inequality and her experiences as a woman in Congress.<ref>"[http://fora.tv/2013/07/18/Women_in_Politics_How_They_are_Challenging_Status_Quo Women in Politics: How They are Challenging Status Quo" panel video]. Fora.tv, July 18, 2013</ref>

title: Mary Bono
deleted: In August 2013, Bono was a panelist at the ''National Journal'''s Women 2020 event and discussed her experiences as a woman in Congress and work that still needs to be done regarding gender equality.<ref>"[http://fora.tv/2013/07/18/Women_in_Politics_How_They_are_Challenging_Status_Quo Women in Politics: How They are Challenging Status Quo" panel video]. Fora.tv, July 18, 2013</ref>

Bono's national profile increased significantly in 1998 when she sat on the [[United States House of Representatives Committee on the Judiciary|House Judiciary panel]] to consider [[Impeachment of Bill Clinton|impeachment articles]] against [[Bill Clinton]].<ref>Grove, Lloyd. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-srv/politics/special/clinton/stories/bono121198.htm Vote Tops Bono's Year of Decisions]. ''The Washington Post''. 1998-12-11. Retrieved 2012-06-27.</ref>
